column5: Nice fish, looks like you had a good one.
Congrats again G.  Glad to hear that the wrist didn't keep you from having a spectacular time!  Beauty fish and kudos to the Extreme guys!
awesome day on the water congrats
This was an amazing report G!  I remember when you won this...and thought it went to a guy really deserving of it.  Glad to see it was a day to remember out there.  Kudos to Extreme Angler too!
Great report, Gerritt.  A little envious, here.
Wow great fish, excellent going
WOW! Some monsters there Gerritt. Congrats to you and a round of applause to the folks at Extreme Angler!
Caught this earlier Gerritt when on the run through.  Remembered to just get back and give ya the thumbs up.  Good times with some real solid bass hounds.
SWEET !!! Fantastic report Gerritt.  Glad it all went well for you.
That's super Gerritt.  Looks like it was a great time.  Nice smallies there bud.  Joey
nice. good day out.  hopefully i'll get out on thursday or friday.

Nice going Gerritt!  WTG and congrats on the free lesson and swag, good on ya Team Extreme Angler. It's nice to see them responding to your post as well.  Some sold guys there!  Cheers Mark and Karl. Geoff
WTG Gerritt!  Congrats to you and the Extreme Team.  Some beauties there bud!

Wow what a day!.. after conflicting schedules (due to my work demands) and emails back and forth between Karl Kalonka and I, we finally found a date that worked.. Some of you may remember I won a trip to fish with Team Extreme.. Well today was the day.. and let me tell you they did not disappoint!  My morning started @ 4am to meet up with Karl @ the King Rd. Carpool for 7am,(Man was it Nippy out!) we hooked, up did our introductions and off we went to hit up Simcoe in search of Monster Smallies.. While on our way to Simcoe, Karl gave Mark Kulik a call who was already at the ramp untied and waiting for us to arrive to begin our day... I met Mark, launched the boat and off we went.  If no one has seen Mark's boat let me tell you.. it is a sweet ride!  Now I have to admit I was not much of a Bass fisherman before this outing, Sure I have caught them indirectly.. and have only targeted them on the odd occasion, So I was a little unsure as to what to expect fishing with pros. Without so much as a bat of the eye I was handed a rod and told "Here, Start casting" I should mention it was pretty windy out there today.. Boat control was key here, and Mark kept us on line and into fish!  So there I am, Casting tubes into the wind (Did I mention it was windy?) and drifting them letting them bounce off bottom.. all the while admiring the rod I was holding... Man St. Croix Legend Tournament rods are Sweet! and super sensitive.. and here I had an arsenal of them at my disposal!.. I was in fishing gear heaven!  Mark was first up with a respectable Smallie... which he graciously said "Here you fight him!" what a powerful species.. I can see why people become addicted to these Green and Brown devils!  Karl was up next with a beauty of a fish not long after Marks  in between the action we all had a chance to feel one another out and the conversions began.. Let me tell you, these two guys are hilarious, I was afraid on a few occasion I was going to wet my float suit.. Fun does not even begin to describe the day I had.. it was simply amazing!  Eventually I was able to tell the difference between bottom and the very slight tap tap of the bass. and landed a few of my own! Wow! Here I am catching Bass with well respected tournament and TV show professionals! I think at the end of the day we went 12 for 16? We had a couple breakoff's etc but to be honest it was hard to keep track, listening to all the banter on the boat, I know a few were released boat side but we held onto a few for pictures, did I mention it was windy?  What an experience is all I can muster right now.. I am exhausted and my internal clock is all screwed up (Time change.. lack of sleep), my lips are wind burnt, my cheeks are red... but MAN what an amazing outing!  These guys are true professionals and gentlemen, and I would be honoured to be invited back to fish with them again..  Who ever wins their next contest is one Lucky dude! is all I can say  Thank you to OFC and Extreme Angler for this awesome experience!  Ohhh yeah and I picked up a ton of free Shwag.. including one of the St. Croix rods I was admiring!!  Thanks again Karl and Mark for an awesome day on the water! I learned a ton!  G.  http://www.extremeanglertv.com/
Great stuff Gerritt !  Is that what they call the Monkey in the middle shot??
Fantastic stuff Gerrit, that sure sounds fun, and a sweet rod and the end too.
AWESOME !  You guys did amazing with that wind out there today . we were in the north end of Simcoe and I wouldn't have dreamed of trying our open water smallie spots  congrats TB
Ya' could'a told me yesterday, then I would have been jealous a whole day early. Looks like a good time was had by all!
Sounds like an awesome day on the water! Those are some monster smallies.
I'm very green with envy right now    Glad you had a great experience.
Wow! Thanks fer sharin' man. I am really happy that you had a good day out with some professionals.  Those fish are really big, too!  It could not happen to someone who deserves it more.
WOW that was a great day .....can you say jealous,  cause I am
Good for you Gerritt. Couldn't have happened to a better guy.
sounds like a great opportunity!!! nice fish and congrats!   Hawk
Gerritt, sounds like you had an awesome day man!!!  Being out on the boat, laughing your ass off really can't be beat, add a few fish to the mix and you're in heaven!
WOW what an experience WTG Gerritt.  Regards, Sam
Sounds like a great day Gerritt. How about a "ten things that pros do that you schlubs don't" post? Jim

nice gerritt, nothing like fall smallies in big water....Simcoe is a unique fishery with big big toads but now you have to experience erie when those 4's get tossed because they are small......and if you time it right and are on the spots 3-4's till your arm litterly falls off this time of year....
Great photo! I like the flag in the background with those giant smallies.

LOL Wayne!... I was kneeling On the seat! dang I look short there... I learned a ton! and let me tell you.. the laughs that were had were priceless! somethings are best left unsaid and you had to be there! and for some reason I still have the "clown" tune in my head!! Doo Doo Doo Do do da da doo doo doo da dada... good times and something that will not soon be forgotten!  G
Glad you enjoyed the day Gerrit it was great having you out with us ! Anytime you can catch big smallies and enjoy a few good laughs ! talk soon.  Mark
holy crap
Thats great Gerritt!!  Good karma and Im glad for ya!!
An experience I am sure you will not soon forget!  Congrats Gerritt and WTG!!   Bill
Very cool, musta been a blast...

G-Man,  Your very welcome. Glad you enjoyed the day.   Only a true "extreme angler" would dare fight those giant smallies with a hand just out of a cast- You not only had the forearm "burn", but sore paw to go with it. Thanks for the laughs too!  KK http://www.extremeanglertv.com
Great time it seems! Well done and I too, can't think of anyone who deserves this more! Congrats G and well done! HH
Atta Boy G!  Great report and those are some sweet smallies mang.  Great way to go EXTREME.  wicked. HD
